fields.Notes: Amman; Five dialects: Shapsug, Bzhedug, Abzakh, Karbadian (Homeland Dialect), Karbadian (Diaspora Dialect)
fields.Translation:
SHAPSUG DIALECT
00:00:00-00:00:20

BZHEDUG DIALECT
00:00:21-00:00:40

ABZAKH DIALECT
00:00:41-00:00:57

KARBADIAN HOMELAND DIALECT
00:00:57-00:01:17

KARBADIAN DIASPORA DIALECT
00:01:18-00:01:42

Shapsug Dialect
My name is Yenal, son of Hassan. I am a Shapsug. I can speak Shapsug fluently, but I went to the village of ______ and learned how to speak some Shapsug there.

Bzhedug Dialect
The Shapsug, Abzakh, and Bzhedug in Jordan all speak Bzhedug. I am a Shapsug, my father is Shapsug, my mother is Abzakh but I speak Bzhedug because the Bzhedug language is in between the Shapsug and Abzahkh languages. That's why we all speak the Bzhedug language.

Abzakh Dialect
The old men, all the elders of the village "Rehaniya" speak Abzakh and there is where I learned the language during my visit as a guest. I would like to tell them all thank you for that.

Karbadian Homeland Dialect
I learned Karbadian in the Circassian school here. And the Cirassian Karbadian that we learned in school is exactly like the dialect in Nalchik in the homeland where the words end in "ish" and not with "s".

Karbadian Diaspora Dialect
The Karbadians in the diaspora speak a dialect that doesn't exactly match the one in Nalchik where the words end in "s" and not "ish". (He then goes on to explain the differences in the dialects in the video. That's all I got from him for this dialect transcription).
Demographics: 117,500 in Russian Federation (2010 census). Population total all countries: 491,800. 0 monolinguals ( Ministry of Education, Adygea Republic). Ethnic population: 129,000 (2010 census).
516,000 in Russian Federation (2010 census). Population total all countries: 1,628,500. 36,700 monolinguals (2002 census). Ethnic population: 590,000 (2010 census).
